message:
Anyone here working on their own ideas?

Are you struggling with marketing them, reaching to potential audience, or converting these into paying customers?

If you are keen to talk about these here, maybe I (and others) can help.
I can offer you ideas, strategies, and more focused tips and tools.

Also, feel free to message me privately if you don't feel like posting details in here. And don't worry, I won't charge you for it!

data.message: Are you a marketung geek now?
Well, let's say I've seen a few tricks that worked :)

Oh, that's a perfect time for this post.

So, I've worked on around 5 projects, kollohom fashalo el 7amdolellah. There was one that actually had potential, but Cambridge sent us an e-mail and they were not really happy about it and therefore we had to take it down. The other 4 were either clones of already successful ones, or technical nightmares. A few hours ago I've also submitted a PSD to Themeforest and "it didn't reach their quality threshold."

I know that's not directly about marketing or so, but maybe it's close enough. It would be nice to know what do you think.
Mohamed Meligy I'm not liking thos marketing direction, and it's not really geeky

Samy. I posted this here because the projects I'd like to help are the geeky ones. I'm not expecting to find those trying to get a weight loss or physical craft workshop in here. Feel free to stop notifications of this post though if it feels wrong, or to discuss with the group founder and other admins if it should not be here at all

Well, one thing to remember Amjad Mash'al is: you sure heard about how existing competition is not a bad thing (your thing about clones), and how it's also market validation. I don't know if you find help in me saying it but: I have found that this is SO TRUE. If you are the first to do something, it's too risky and maybe no one wants you idea and you might want to go through more validation steps to tell otherwise.

I have zero experience with marketing.. What I only know is to create the idea and a good attractive website for it  and maybe pay for some Google ads.. And thats it for me :/
Know where exactly I should start ?

Hi Muhammad Saleh,
The http://entreprogrammers.com/ prodcast can be a very good start, also check the 80-20 marketting book

Another good thing is to have a specific set of goals and finding a "mastermind group", a few people who have similar activities ongoing. Every week or so you meet and tell what you did and what problems you have (including: what to do now?). The concept is from the classic book Think & Grow Rich, but is very common in entrepreneurial world
Ideally this post can turn into one. But I'm more concerned about finding people who are on that level and of challenges first

Let me first say that I find this post highly relevant to this audience, even though on the long run it might deserve it's own "geek entrepreneurs" group/meetup/google hangout. 

While most of us build cool projects mostly because we love them as geeks, we also owe it to ourselves and everybody else to market them properly, so everybody can learn and benefit from them... whether you are an entrepreneur who wants to gain customers for their product, or simply if you want to spread the word about your awesome free open source project.

Marketing is a big part of every business, I see it this way, geeks have the know-how, they also can feel potential markets, but why do geeks work for others? Because they don't know how to run a business with all its legal stuff, marketing, etc ...

If only geeks can get how to run a business, they won't have to work for a bunch of (e3mli 3 kilo features) people.
e3mli 3 kilo features we 3awezhom khalsen we tested embare7
